author: lucassaldanhaconsensys
content:
The issue here was that we were investigating an potential issue in Teku submitting voluntary exits, and we thought that maybe we were doing the wrong thing by not locking the topic fork digest using Capella. However, when I cheked some of the other clients, they seem to be all doing the same thing.

This is the part of the spec that got us confused (reference https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/deneb/p2p-interface.md#topics-and-messages)

> The voluntary_exit topic is implicitly modified due to the lock-in use of CAPELLA_FORK_VERSION for this message signature validation for EIP-7044.

author: lucassaldanhaconsensys
content: We think everyone is doing the same thing, sub'ing the topic with Deneb digest. Just the wording that the topic was implicitly modified made us question our implementation.

author: lucassaldanhaconsensys
content:
So I think what we need:
1. Confirm that all clients are doing the same thing
2. Possibly clarify the spec to avoid any misunderstandings (if it is only us it is ok, we now know) ðŸ™‚
